results.title: Convicted on all charges
results.brief_description: The murder of George Floyd by a Minneapolis police officer was captured on video and incited waves of protests in the US and around the world. When the jury swiftly and unanimously convicted the officer of all charges, huge crowds gathered to pay their respects to Floyd at the intersection where he took his last breaths. Minnesota’s attorney general, Keith Ellison welcomed the conviction stating, “This verdict reminds us that we must make enduring… enduring systemic, societal change.” Three other officers face trial for aiding and abetting murder and manslaughter. Key to securing the conviction was a video taken by a bystander.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

The murder of George Floyd by a Minneapolis police officer was captured on video and incited waves of protests in the US and around the world. When the jury swiftly and unanimously convicted the officer of all charges, huge crowds gathered to pay their respects to Floyd at the intersection where he took his last breaths. Three other officers face trial for aiding and abetting murder and manslaughter.

results.title: Convicted
results.creator_credit: Mike Piper, Kay Pavlou and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: 5% of prisoners in Australian prisons are women. 85% of these are in prison for drug-related crimes. In this film the women of Northfield Prison Complex in South Australia, prisoners, warders, psychologists, recount their experiences. The specific problems of women - the care of children, familial attitudes, low self-esteem are highlighted as is the lack of rehabilitation which leads to 65% recidivism.

results.title: Conversion to automatic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
Demonstrates how the automatic transmission operates and discusses the routine procedures the driver should follow for the safe driving of an automatic vehicle.

results.title: Conversations with a dead poet: Alan Wearne recalls John Forbes [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: John Izzard, Geoff Burton, Seedwillow and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Alan Wearne, poet and tutor hosts this documentary about his friend and colleague John Forbes (1950-98), one of Australia’s most prominent modern poets with his distinctly gritty writing about urban Melbourne and Sydney. Drawing on extracts from several of Forbes’ poems, and discussions with friends and devotees of his writing, the following works are explored in detail: “Tropical skiing”; “On the beach”; “Stalin’s holidays”; “The Stunned mullet”; “Damaged glamour”.

results.title: Conversation in the garden
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Richard Mudford
results.brief_description: A couple are seen in a suburban garden; outwardly they appear polite, inwardly their thoughts vividly snake through the undergrowth. Cast includes Heather Bolton and Stephen Clements.

results.title: Conversation
results.creator_credit: Young America Films and Centron Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speech”.
Demonstrates and explains how conversation (informal speech) reaches into every phase of our everyday life; that is our surest way of making or losing friends, of being hired or fired. Through dramatic incidents, the film illustrates some important do’s and don’ts in social and business conversation, and indicates effective speech techniques to use.

results.title: Convention of Yanmar Overseas Agents, 1964
results.brief_description:
Convention held in Japan for overseas agents of the company Yanmar, founded by Magokichi Yamaoka. Shows the delegates involved in various activities including a visit to the factory, a bus trip to a memorial for the founder, group conference and discussion, social evening event, presentation of awards, a golf day, and the final gathering before departure.
Silent film - no credits available.

results.title: Controversy over the moon
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Charles L. Finance
results.brief_description: Presents the controversy concerning the geological make-up of the moon - specifically the origin of large lunar craters. Two eminent scientists interpret the same available data and discuss reasons for their divergent views. Suitable for upper secondary level.
